title: Lesson 43
paragraph: This lesson covers war and violence, including aggression, combat, and domination.

words.meaning: demonstrating aggression and willingness to fight
words.example: The bellicose leader threatened neighboring countries.

words.meaning: combative and aggressive in support of a cause
words.example: Militant activists protested against the policy.

words.meaning: ready or eager to fight or argue
words.example: His combative attitude caused tension in the meeting.

words.meaning: ready or likely to attack or confront
words.example: The company took an aggressive approach to expand its market.
The belligerent nations refused to negotiate.

words.meaning: the act of taking control by force
words.example: The conquest of the territory changed the map.
The city faced near-annihilation during the war.

words.meaning: the act of bringing under control
words.example: The subjugation of the local population was complete.
